titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Robert Wilson papers,
titlestmt.author: Columbia University Libraries. Rare Book and Manuscript Library; machine readable finding aid created by Columbia University Libraries Digital Library Program Division

publicationstmt.publisher:
Rare Book and Manuscript Library
Columbia University Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Machine readable finding aid generated from MARC-AMC source via XSLT conversion June 26, 2009

physdesc.extent: 148 linear ft. (ca. 149,000 items in 292 boxes; 1 phonodisc; 1 audio cassette; 15 oversize folders; 3 scrapbooks; 108 posters)

repository.corpname: Columbia University,Rare Book and Manuscripts Library,

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: American dramatist, director, designer, performer, writer and artist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, outlines, scripts, production notes, technical materials, story boards, contracts, posters, programs, announcements, recordings, reviews, and other printed materials relating to all aspects of Robert Wilson's theater works, opera, films, artwork and video productions. There are files for all of Wilson's theatrical performances, the most extensive of which is the CIVIL warS. Also included are the files of the Byrd Hoffman Foundation.

Series II contains press materials for 1988 and research materials for King Lear, The Forest, and Parsifal, as well as miscellaneous research files for 1987. In addition, one can find various documents (letters, contracts, etc.) relating to the following productions: The Forest; Alcestis; The Golden Windows; Patio; Edison; Black Rider; Murder (Deafman Glance); CIVIL warS; and Knee Plays. A group of miscellaneous files follows, containing such items as scores, research materials, and budget documentation. In the oversize folders of the series are scores for The Golden Windows and De Materie, research for Black Rider, a press kit for Knee Plays, and various King Lear documents.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into 3 series:

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Series II, Box 20: Permission of the Byrd Hoffman Foundation required.

This collection is located off-site. You will need to request this material from the Rare Book and Manuscript Library at least twenty-four (24) hours in advance to use the collection in the Rare Book and Manuscript Library reading room.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Papers Wilson, Robert and the Byrd Hoffman Foundation Gift

custodhist.p: Gift of Robert Wilson and the Byrd Hoffman Foundation, 1988-1991.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of specific item; Date (if known); Robert Wilson Papers, Box and Folder; Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Columbia University Library.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. Permission to publish material from the collection must be requested from the Curator of Manuscripts/University Archivist, Rare Book and Manuscript Library (RBML). The RBML approves permission to publish that which it physically owns; the responsibility to secure copyright permission rests with the patron.

scopecontent.p: Herein are filed materials relating to Byrd Hoffman Foundation activities, Robert Wilson in general, and the works of his Associates. Also included in this section are materials related to lectures and other public appearances unrelated to performance. Also included here are files related to suspended projects and works not completed. For works related to productions see the alphabetical list of productions. There are separate files of materials related to videos produced as independent works and to exhibitions of his artistic works. PRODUCTION FILES (Boxes 24-185). Herein are files related to specific productions. Also included are materials related to videos of those productions or videos of the same title. Videos that were produced only as vodeos are liste under Videos. Press materials about productions may be found either with the production files and/or in the Press files. The "Press files" are arranged chronologically for each production. Printed materials and press materials that were not excerpted from the journals in which they appear are filed after "Press." Materials related to suspended projects and works not completed can be found among the General Files. VIDEOS (Boxes 186-197). Herein are filed papers relating to video projects that were independent of theatrical productions.
See also Flat for scrapbook of photocopies of correspondence and conversations between R. Wilson and Dallas Pratt

scopecontent.p: The CIVIL warS Administrative files include correspondence and other materials related to technical matters, production details, printed materials, etc beyond contracts and budgetary files. Users should also note that an attempt has been made to group the materials by production, but this has not always been possible becouse of problems of identification and some attempt has been made to preserve the integrity of the arrangement of the materials as they were at the Byrd Hoffman Foundation and at Art Service International.
